reviewText: Absolutely terrible beyond words. Not that the pedagogic intent is not laudable, but the instructor makes so many mistakes and shows such an ignorance of the topic that it is actually dangerous to take this since "a little knowledge is a dangerous thing." I recommend pulling this course immediately until it is improved and corrected- items such as using terminal/perpetuity values and Free Cash Flows in DCF valuation are way too important to leave out as they are left out here. Lin Giralt, CMC, Academic Fellow ICMCI, Wharton MBA Finance 1992.

While the content may appear interesting, the actual guided project is very frustrating to complete. The external tool that they use (Rhyme) is laggy and inflexible. You cannot even use spreadsheet software on your own computer because the video will not play unless you are in the Rhyme browser tab. I do not recommend.
Instructor does not possess clarity.
I don't want to learn this course

T​he instructor makes a buch of errors both in explaining and in his calculations. He is not a native English speaker, but the pronunciation are ok. However, his communication is confusing. It doesn't seem like he had prepared what to say, but just tried to wing it.

This course is really not worth the time, and definitely not worth the money. The system utilized in the project, rhyme, is extremely slow and actually crashed when I was almost complete with the project, erasing all of the work I had done. As far as the project itself, it is rudimentary and superficial. This is not a robust introduction to WACC or valuation methods in general, but simply how to perform very simple calculations in excel/sheets. The instructor repeatedly refers to his previous courses (all separate and 9.99 each, of course) throughout the project. It is quite annoying to pay for premium content on Coursera only to be marketed to again and again!

Interesting project, but not enough explainations and some errors in the sheet (bad formula for the Beta and, I suppose, for the Cash Flow Growth, which seems to use the Net Change in Cash in an improper way).

Overall, a great course to take if you're interested to learn about valuation and finance. It's my first time to take a WACC course, and I would recommend beginners like myself to supplement this course with more simplified and less technical materials from Youtube and Investopedia. I liked that this course offered a structure so that aspiring students have a guide as to which topics should be covered first and so on. Thank you Sir Bekhruzbek Ochilov!
Good explanation with practical examples
The explanation on CAPM (first video of the course) was a bit confusing. Overall, the course was really nice, hands-on and well-structured.
HELPFULL
If you want to start into valuation and have a small idea of how to get WACC this is the course, short and simple, but it assumes many things that are not right when doing real valuation.
